conclusion: A charged particle (+q, mass m) starts at origin O, moving at 45° to the y-axis
Fourth quadrant contains a uniform magnetic field pointing inward (into the page)
First quadrant contains a uniform electric field pointing down (-y direction)
At point P(3L,L), the particle has velocity v₀ in the +x direction
We need to find the total time for the particle to travel from O to P
In a uniform magnetic field, a charged particle follows a circular path
The radius of the circular path is r = mv/qB
The particle follows a quarter-circle from O to Q
At point Q, the particle is traveling in the +x direction
At point Q, the particle enters the electric field region
In the electric field, the particle experiences a force in the -y direction, creating a parabolic trajectory
The particle starts at Q with velocity v (same magnitude as at point Q but in the +x direction) and ends at P(3L,L) with velocity v₀ in the +x direction
The radius of the circular path r = mv₁/(qB)
Point Q is where the particle exits the magnetic field region
Based on the 45° entry angle and quarter-circle path, Q must be on the x-axis
The particle experiences acceleration a = qE/m in the -y direction
The x-component of velocity remains constant
Point Q must be at (r,0) where r is the radius of the circular path
Time t₁ (O to Q) is t₁ = πr/(2v₁) = πm/(2qB)
Time t₂ (Q to P) for x-component: t₂ = (3L - r)/v
Time t₂ (Q to P) for y-component: t₂ = √(2mL/qE)
The total time t_total = t₁ + t₂ = πm/(2qB) + √(2mL/qE)
